title: Leaverbuster reevaluation.
body:
tl;dr - i got leaver busters for making the game a remake and saving my teams LP

Context:

i was playing in a ranked game, and because of the client i was about to play {{champion:28}} without {{summoner:11}} , so instead of playing, wasting time, and making my team lose LP for my mistake, i didn't join the game, sure enough, the "after-game screen" came up 3 minutes later, and i had gotten leaver busters. (mind you i don't often actually leave games at all)

replies.body:
A few things to note about the Leavebuster system is that it will look at consistent leaving/AFKing over shorter periods of time (for example, 3-4 instances of leaving/AFKing over the course of a week or 2 may be enough to trigger an LPQ [these values are purely speculation]). It also looks at the length of each individual instance and (if it's not been changed) should only count those with a duration of at least 5 minutes (or those that resulted in a remake). 

If you're adamant that you've not left frequently enough recently, you can submit a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us) for further clarification, but given it's an LPQ (and not, say, a ban, temp or otherwise) it's extremely unlikely for the punishment to be revoked. At the very least, it might indicate a new problem with the Leavebuster system or help Riot nail down an existing one.

I know it sucks, but no system is perfect. You could just be one of the unlucky few who've been caught in the crossfire.
On top of this, ranked games are treated far more seriously than norms/aram/ai. You can get a LPQ from just one ranked leave.
